org.epochx.stats
Class StatsManager

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.stats.StatsManager

public class StatsManager
extends java.lang.Object

Gathers data and statistics about events that occur during execution of the given Model and makes them available for use. Any component may add data into the StatsManager by using the addXxxData methods. The StatsManager will also use its internal StatsEngine instance to generate statistics upon request, and stash the results internally. The data that is stored will only be held for the current/previous incident of that event that took place. All data for an event will be cleared upon the start of the next incident.

addRunData

public void addRunData(java.lang.String field,
                       java.lang.Object value)
Inserts an item of data about a run into the stats manager associated with the given field key. If data is already stored against the given field then it will be overwritten.

Parameters:
field - the key to associate with the given data value.
value - the statistics/data to be stored.

getRunStat

public java.lang.Object getRunStat(java.lang.String field)
Retrieves the statistic data about a run associated with the provided field. If the stat field does not exist or is otherwise unavailable then null will be returned.

This object will start by checking its internal storage for the field, if it holds an entry for that field then the data will be returned. If no entry is stored, then the StatsEngine instance will be asked if it is able to generate it. If it can be generated then it will then be stored for future requests and then returned. If the StatsEngine is unable to create the statistic then null will be returned from this method.

The object type of the instance that is returned will be dependent upon the field requested. The object type is normally specified in the documentation for the field.

Parameters:
field - the name of the statistics field to retrieve.
Returns:
an object which represents the statistics data requested or null if the field does not exist of the data is otherwise unavailable.

getGenerationStat

public java.lang.Object getGenerationStat(java.lang.String field)

Parameters:

Returns:
an object which represents the statistics data requested or null if the field does not exist of the data is otherwise unavailable.

getRunStats

public java.lang.Object[] getRunStats(java.lang.String... fields)
Retrieves a sequence of run statistics associated with the given fields. The returned array will be of the same length as the number of fields provided and each element will represent each field in order.

Each statistic field requested will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getRunStat(String) method.

Parameters:
fields - the names of the statistics fields to retrieve.
Returns:
an array of Objects where each element is the statistic field generated for the requested field at that array index. If a field is for data that does not exist or is otherwise unavailable then that array element will be null.

getGenerationStats

public java.lang.Object[] getGenerationStats(java.lang.String... fields)
Retrieves a sequence of generation statistics associated with the given fields. The returned array will be of the same length as the number of fields provided and each element will represent each field in order.

Each statistic field requested will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getGenerationStat(String) method.

Parameters:
fields - the names of the statistics fields to retrieve.
Returns:
an array of Objects where each element is the statistic field generated for the requested field at that array index. If a field is for data that does not exist or is otherwise unavailable then that array element will be null.

printRunStats

public void printRunStats(java.lang.String... fields)
Retrieve and print to the standard output the sequence of run statistics referenced by the given fields. The statistics will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getRunStats(String[]) method. The result of calling the toString() method on each statistic object returned will be printed separated by a '\t' tab character, and the line terminated with a '\n' newline character.

Parameters:
fields - the names of the statistics fields to print out.

printRunStats

public void printRunStats(java.lang.String[] fields,
                          java.lang.String separator)
Retrieve and print to the standard output the sequence of run statistics referenced by the given fields. The statistics will be obtained according to the contract specified by the getRunStats(String[]) method. The result of calling the toString() method on each statistic object returned will be printed separated by a the separator String parameter provided, and the line terminated with a '\n' newline character.

Parameters:
fields - the names of the statistics fields to print out.
separator - the String to be printed between each statistic.
